data.title: biography1
data.text:
ANGELICA GAVALDON (an-hell-ick-a)

Birthdate: October 3, 1973

Birthplace: El Centro, California, USA

Height: 5' 3" (1.60 m)

Plays: Right-handed (two-handed backhand)

Status: Pro (February 19, 1990)

WTA Singles Record: 86-118

Career Prize Money: $504, 376

WTA TOUR singles titles: 0

WTA TOUR doubles titles: 0

(Grand Slam titles: 0

ITF Women's Circuit singles titles: 3

GRAND SLAM (SINGLES) HISTORY

00 99 98 97 96 95 94 93 92 91 90 89 88 Australian Open 2r - 1r - 1r Qf 1r 1r 1r 1r Qf - - Roland Garros - - - - - 1r 2r 1r - - 1r - - Wimbledon - - - - 1r 3r 1r 2r - - 3r - - US Open - - - 1r 1r 3r 2r 1r - - 2r - - Chase Championships (singles) - - - - - - - - - - - - -

WTA TOUR RANKING (SEASON-ENDING, SINGLES)

2000-261; 1999-379 (Injury Ranking: 108); 1998-NR (Injury Ranking: 108); 1997-107; 1996-208;

1995-36; 1994-119; 1993-64; 1992-137; 1991-354; 1990-51; 1989-182; 1988-265

CAREER HIGHLIGHTS - SINGLES

WINNER(3): 1997-ITF/Tashkent; 1992-Futures/San Luis Potosi; 1991-Futures/San Luis Potosi

SEMIFINALIST(2): 1990-Oklahoma; 1993-San Juan

QUARTERFINALIST(5): 1990-Australian Open; 1993-Brisbane, Oklahoma, Quebec City;

1995-Australian Open

THIRD ROUND(11): 1990-Boca Raton, Wimbledon; 1993-Hilton Head, Amelia Island, Manhattan Beach;

1994-San Diego, Manhattan Beach; 1995-Delray Beach, Key Biscayne, Wimbledon, US Open;

CAREER HIGHLIGHTS - DOUBLES

QUARTERFINALIST: 1996-Surabaya w/Gaspar, 1995-Strasbourg w/Rottier; 1994-San Diego w/Pleming;

1990-San Diego w/Rehe

ADDITIONAL HIGHLIGHTS: Mexican Fed Cup Team 1992. Mexican Olympic Team 1992, 1996

High Career Singles Rank: #34

QUICK FACTS

* Was off the Tour from January 1998 to August 1999 with injuries suffered in two different car

accidents, one in January 1998 and the other just before she was ready to come back to the tour

* At the 2000 Australian Open, played her first Grand Slam event in two years and just her third in over three years, winning her first round

* Won a 1997 satellite tournament, her first professional title in five years

* Two-time Australian Open quarterfinalist: In 1995, upset third seed Jana Novotna and 15th

seed Lori McNeil; in 1990, as a qualifier playing in her first Grand Slam tournament, upset seventh seed Hana Mandlikova and 15th seed Gigi Fernandez

* Upset 11th seed Iva Majoli in first round of 1995 Wimbledon en route to a third-round finish

* Defeated Catarina Lindqvist and Helena Sukova at 1992 Olympics; also represented Mexico

in the 1996 Olympic Games

* Has other career wins over Zina Garrison Jackson and Amy Frazier

* Nominated for 1990 WTA TOUR Most Impressive Newcomer

* In 1989, ranked No. 1 in Southern California 18s; in 1988, ranked No. 3 in U.S. 16s; No. 1 in Southern California 16s

* Finished school while off the tour for 18 months (1991-part of 1992)

* Coached by Mario Tabares, Raj Maharaj

* Started playing tennis at age 8 at a local club
